shortdesc.ph: Sets an external MediaProjection to capture screen video streams.
Sets an external MediaProjection to capture screen video stream.
Sets an external MediaProjection to capture screen video stream.

section.p: After successfully calling this method, the external MediaProjection you set will replace the MediaProjection obtained by the SDK to capture screen video streams. When screen sharing stops or is destroyed, the SDK automatically releases the MediaProjection.

After this method is successfully called, the external MediaProjection you set will replace the one applied by the SDK to capture the screen video stream. When screen sharing is stopped or is destroyed, the SDK automatically releases the MediaProjection.

After successfully calling this method, the external MediaProjection you set will replace the one requested by the SDK to capture the screen video stream. When screen sharing stops or is destroyed, the SDK automatically releases the MediaProjection.
section.note: This method is for Android only. You must obtain the MediaProjection permission before calling this method.
This method is applicable to Android only. You must obtain MediaProjection permission before calling this method.
This method is for Android only. You must request MediaProjection permission before calling this method.

section.title: Scenario
section.p:
If you are capable of obtaining MediaProjection yourself, you can use your own MediaProjection to replace the one obtained by the SDK. Here are two usage scenarios:
On customized system devices, you can avoid system pop-ups (which require user permission for screen capture) and directly start screen capture.
In a screen sharing process with one or more subprocesses, this avoids errors caused by creating objects in subprocesses that may lead to capture failure.

section.title: Timing
section.p: This method must be called before .
This method must be called before .
This method must be called before .

plentry.pd: A [MediaProjection](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/media/projection/MediaProjection) object used to capture screen video streams.
A [MediaProjection](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/media/projection/MediaProjection) object used to capture screen video stream.
A [MediaProjection](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/media/projection/MediaProjection) object used to capture the screen video stream.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
